prompt: Priority: 1) Experience > 10 years 2) Age < 40. Candidates: A (12 yrs, 42), B (8 yrs, 35). Select:
Priority: 1) Graduate 2) Experience 3) Age. Candidate: Non-graduate with 10 years exp. Decision:
explanation: Graduate is first priority. Must meet it.

prompt: Priority order: Quality > Cost > Speed. Option A: High quality, high cost. Option B: Low quality, low cost, fast. Choose:
explanation: Quality is top priority. Choose A.

Leave approval priority: 1) Medical 2) Emergency 3) Planned. Employee request: Planned vacation. Priority:

explanation: State students (not local) get second priority.

prompt: Budget allocation priority: 1) Salaries 2) Operations 3) Development. Available funds limited. Which cut first:
IT support priority: 1) Server down 2) Network issue 3) PC problem. Issue: Network connectivity. Priority:

explanation: Equal P1, use P2 (seniority) as tiebreaker.

prompt: Selection criteria in order: Age < 30 > Degree > Experience. Candidate: 32 years, PhD, 10 years. Status:

Funding priority: 1) Ongoing projects 2) Approved proposals 3) New proposals. Request: Approved but not started. Priority:
Crisis response: 1) Life-threatening 2) Property damage 3) Inconvenience. Situation: Power outage. Category:
explanation: Power outage is inconvenience, third priority.

prompt: Selection order: 1) Written test 2) Interview 3) HR round. Candidate cleared: Written test only. Status:
Priority for loan: 1) Credit score > 750 2) Income > 5L 3) Collateral. Applicant: Score 720, Income 8L, Has collateral. Eligible:
answers: Fails P1, meets P2 and P3

prompt: Task completion priority: 1) Deadline today 2) This week 3) This month. Task deadline: Next week. Priority:
explanation: Next week deadline = this week = P2.

prompt: Selection: 1) Sports quota 2) Ex-servicemen 3) General merit. Applicant: Ex-serviceman. Selection priority:
Priority matrix: High Impact + High Effort = P2. High Impact + Low Effort = P1. Task: High impact, low effort. Priority:
explanation: High impact, low effort = highest priority.

prompt: Inventory priority: 1) Fast-moving items 2) Medium 3) Slow. Item type: Medium turnover. Restock priority:
explanation: Medium turnover items get second priority.

prompt: Priority for training: 1) New employees 2) Promoted employees 3) Existing. Employee status: Recently promoted. Priority:
Selection: 1) Technical skills 2) Communication 3) Leadership. Candidate: Strong technical, weak communication. Assessment:
explanation: Meets first priority, weak on second.

prompt: Priority system: A > B > C > D. Tie at level B between two options. Tiebreaker:
explanation: Use next priority level as tiebreaker.

prompt: Emergency evacuation priority: 1) Children 2) Elderly 3) Women 4) Men. Person: Elderly woman. Priority:
explanation: Elderly is higher priority than women.

prompt: Priority hiring: 1) Diversity candidate 2) Experienced 3) Fresh graduate. Candidate: Experienced diversity. Position:
answers: First priority (meets both P1 and P2)

explanation: P1 is must-have. Cannot proceed without.

explanation: Domicile is higher priority than merit.
